articles.headline: Banks’ Leases to Hedge Funds Are Questioned
articles.snippet: Regulators are growing concerned about banks that lease office space to hedge funds in hopes of gaining big clients.
articles.abstract: Regulators are growing concerned about banks that lease office space to hedge funds in hopes of gaining big clients.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inside a Philip Johnson-designed office tower in Boston’s financial district, UBS, the giant Swiss bank, is running a “hedge fund hotel.”

articles.headline: Few Iraqis Are Gaining U.S. Sanctuary
articles.snippet: Thousands flee Iraq every day, but the U.S. has placed strict limits on the number of Iraqi refugees allowed to settle in America.
articles.abstract: Thousands flee Iraq every day, but the U.S. has placed strict limits on the number of Iraqi refugees allowed to settle in America.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Jan. 1 — With thousands of Iraqis desperately fleeing this country every day, advocates for refugees, and even some American officials, say there is an urgent need to allow more Iraqi refugees into the United States.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise and Robert F. Worth

articles.headline: Investors Greet New Year With Ambivalence
articles.snippet: After a better-than-average year in the stock market, and a much weaker one in housing, homeowners and investors appear neither exuberant nor glum about 2007.
articles.abstract: After a better-than-average year in the stock market, and a much weaker one in housing, homeowners and investors appear neither exuberant nor glum about 2007.
articles.lead_paragraph: Having enjoyed a year that was better than average in the stock market and a much weaker one in housing, home owners and investors appear neither exuberant nor glum about 2007.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Marjorie Connelly

articles.headline: Young Turn to Web Sites Without Rules
articles.snippet: While sites like YouTube and Myspace crack down on nudity and violence, new sites are treading into the realm of unfiltered live broadcasts.
articles.abstract: While sites like YouTube and Myspace crack down on nudity and violence, new sites are treading into the realm of unfiltered live broadcasts.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 1 — Popular Web sites like YouTube and MySpace have hired the equivalent of school hallway monitors to police what visitors to their sites can see and do by cracking down on piracy and depictions of nudity and violence.

articles.headline: Weathering a Storm in Shelter
articles.snippet: As 2006 ended, the opinion of stock market investors could not have been clearer: there are blue skies ahead.
articles.abstract: As 2006 ended, the opinion of stock market investors could not have been clearer: there are blue skies ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, the United States economy went through a recession that did virtually no damage to the housing market. In 2007, the question is whether the economy can emerge unscathed from a housing recession.

articles.headline: Wal-Mart Puts Some Muscle Behind Power-Sipping Bulbs
articles.snippet: The retailer is determined to push energy-saving light bulbs with the help of some unlikely partners.
articles.abstract: The retailer is determined to push energy-saving light bulbs with the help of some unlikely partners.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a way to cut energy use, it could not be simpler. Unscrew a light bulb that uses a lot of electricity and replace it with one that uses much less.
